name: Document Title: ITP-CIV Landscaping - Ground Preparation
ITP approved for use by: Josie Pavlou
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
Using the correct and complete set of IFC drawings
All drawings are the latest revision
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Samples, records and certificates shall be provided to the Nominated Authority (NA) at least 10 working days prior to bulk delivery.
Following information shall be provided to the NA:
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site won topsoil to be tested to establish what soil amendments and macro and micro nutreints are required to be added to the top soil if  required by planting subcontractor.
Where imported topsoil is used, the topsoil must conform to the properties specified in Table 720.042 and align with IFC Drawings.
METHOD:  Verify, Doc. Review if applicable
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site mulch available from the chipping of on-site indigenous or non-weed vegetation shall be used where possible, otherwise approved mulch stated on IFC drawings.
All wood mulch to be spread in accordance to AS 4454 and conform to required depth stated in IFC drawings.
Imported Wood Mulch shall comply with Table 720.044.
METHOD: Verify, Doc. Review if applicable
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subcontractor ITP to be reviewed and approved by MRPA.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP.
Do not proceed until the NA inspects and  acknowledges requirements for ripping have been met.
Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site topsoil shall be used wherever possible, in preference to imported topsoil. Following subsoil preparation, topsoil shall be spread on planting areas and grassed areas in accordance with minimum top soil depths stated in table 720.071.
• Planting Areas in disturbed areas flatter than 3h:1v  = 150mm Minimum
• Planting Areas in disturbed areas steeper than 3h:1v = 100mm Minimum
• Grassing in disturbed areas =75 mm, except 100 mm in swales
• Individual Tree Planting  within grassed areas =150 mm in disturbed grassed areas
Topsoil shall be spread on planting areas and grassed areas.
Note: Topsoil shall not be compacted.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Do not proceed until the NA inspects & acknowledges requirements for topsoiling and cultivation have been met
Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP
Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected
Reference TeamBinder Material Approval No. if applicable
Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance Final Inspection

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
